page.title: 05LIFE IN MARCHWIEL
page.content:
AN INTERVIEW WITH THE GARAGE ASSISTANT
LISA SPENGELR LIVES IN ROSSETT. SHE HAS WORKED IN THE GARAGE FOR THREE YEARS. SHE ONLY WORKS DURING THE BANK HOLIDAYS AND WHEN THE OWNERS ARE ON HOLIDAY. QUITE A LOT OF PEOPLE GO TO THE GARAGE. THE PEOPLE THAT GO THERE ARE VERY FRIENDLY.
AN INTERVIEW WITH THE COOK OF THE RED LION PUBLIC HOUSE
THE OWNER OF THIS PUBLIC HOUSE IS TERRANCE JOSEPH HARTLEY. IT WAS BUILT IN THE SEVENTEENTH CENTURY. RUTH, THE COOK, HAD WORKED HERE FOR FIFTEEN YEARS. THE PUBLIC HOUSE IS OPEN FROM HALF PAST FIVE UNTIL ELEVEN O'CLOCK. THEY SERVE MEALS AND IN THE SUMMER THEY HAVE BARBECUES IN THE BACK.
